refnamediv.refpurpose: Abstract base class for device handling

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: ArvDevice is an abstract base class for the control of cameras. It provides an easy access to the camera settings, and to its genicam interface for more advanced uses.

refsect2.title: arv_device_create_stream ()
refsect2.programlisting: ArvStream * arv_device_create_stream (ArvDevice *device, ArvStreamCallback callback, void *user_data, GError **error);
refsect2.para: Creates a new ArvStream for video stream handling. See ArvStreamCallback for details regarding the callback function.

entry.para: a GError placeholder, NULL to ignore

refsect2.title: arv_device_create_chunk_parser ()
refsect2.para: Create a ArvChunkParser object, to be used for chunk data extraction from ArvBuffer.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: a new ArvChunkParser object, NULL on error.

refsect2.title: arv_device_read_memory ()
refsect2.programlisting: gboolean arv_device_read_memory (ArvDevice *device, guint64 address, guint32 size, void *buffer, GError **error);
refsect2.para: Reads size bytes from the device memory.

entry.para: a buffer for the storage of the read data

refsect2.title: arv_device_write_memory ()
refsect2.programlisting: gboolean arv_device_write_memory (ArvDevice *device, guint64 address, guint32 size, void *buffer, GError **error);
refsect2.para: Writes size bytes to the device memory.

refsect2.title: arv_device_read_register ()
refsect2.programlisting: gboolean arv_device_read_register (ArvDevice *device, guint64 address, guint32 *value, GError **error);
refsect2.para: Reads the value of a device register.

entry.para: a placeholder for the read value.

refsect2.title: arv_device_write_register ()
refsect2.programlisting: gboolean arv_device_write_register (ArvDevice *device, guint64 address, guint32 value, GError **error);
refsect2.para: Writes value to a device register.

refsect2.title: arv_device_get_genicam_xml ()
refsect2.para: Gets the Genicam XML data stored in the device memory.

entry.para: placeholder for the returned data size (bytes).

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: a pointer to the Genicam XML data, owned by the device.

refsect2.title: arv_device_get_genicam ()
refsect2.para: Retrieves the genicam interface of the given device.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: the genicam node corresponding to the feature name, NULL if not found.

refsect2.title: arv_device_is_feature_available ()
refsect2.para: Return: TRUE if feature is available, FALSE if not or on error.

entry.para: a GError placeholder, NULL to ignore

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: the feature value, FALSE on error.

refsect2.title: arv_device_set_boolean_feature_value ()
refsect2.para: Set the value of a boolean feature.

refsect2.title: arv_device_set_string_feature_value ()
arv_device_get_string_feature_value ()

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: the string feature value, NULL on error.

refsect2.title: arv_device_set_integer_feature_value ()

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: the integer feature value, 0 on error.

refsect2.title: arv_device_get_integer_feature_bounds ()
arv_device_get_integer_feature_increment ()
refsect2.para: Not all integer features have evenly distributed allowed values, which means the returned increment may not reflect the allowed value set.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: feature value increment, or 1 on error.

refsect2.title: arv_device_set_float_feature_value ()

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: the float feature value, 0.0 on error.

refsect2.title: arv_device_get_float_feature_bounds ()
arv_device_get_float_feature_increment ()
refsect2.para: Not all float features have evenly distributed allowed values, which means the returned increment may not reflect the allowed value set.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: feature value increment, or G_MINDOUBLE on error.

refsect2.title: arv_device_is_enumeration_entry_available ()

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: TRUE if the feature and the feature entry are available

refsect2.title: arv_device_dup_available_enumeration_feature_values ()
refsect2.para: Get all the available values of feature , as integers.

entry.para: placeholder for the number of returned values

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: a newly created array of 64 bit integers, which must freed after use using g_free, or NULL on error.

refsect2.title: arv_device_dup_available_enumeration_feature_values_as_strings ()
refsect2.para: Get all the available values of feature , as strings.

entry.para: placeholder for the number of returned values

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: a newly created array of const strings, which must freed after use using g_free, or NULL on error.

refsect2.title: arv_device_dup_available_enumeration_feature_values_as_display_names ()
refsect2.para: Get display names of all the available entries of feature .

entry.para: placeholder for the number of returned values

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: a newly created array of const strings, to be freed after use using g_free, or NULL on error.

refsect2.title: arv_device_set_features_from_string ()
refsect2.para: Set features from a string containing a list of space separated feature assignments or command names. For example:

entry.para: a space separated list of features assignments
a GError placeholder, NULL to ignore

refsect2.title: arv_device_set_range_check_policy ()
refsect2.para: Sets the range check policy. When enabled, before being set, the value of all nodes with an ArvGcFloat or ArvGcInteger interface will be checked against their Min and Max properties.

warning.para: Be aware that some camera may have wrong definition of Min and Max, as this check is defined as not mandatory in the Genicam specification. If this is the case, it will not possible to set the value of the features with faulty Min or Max definition. Range check is disabled by default.

Be aware that some camera may have wrong Cachable properties defined in their Genicam metadata, which may lead to incorrect readouts. Using the debug cache policy, and activating genicam debug output (export ARV_DEBUG=genicam), can help you to check the cache validity. In this mode, every time the cache content is not in sync with the actual register value, a debug message is printed on the console.

refsect2.title: The control-lost signal
refsect2.para: Signal that the control of the device is lost.
This signal may be emited from a thread different than the main one, so please take care to shared data access from the callback.

entry.simpara: user data set when the signal handler was connected.
